description: Dean Christopher Roberts, 56, is the lead plaintiff in a class-action lawsuit against Ottawa that was greenlit by the B.C. Supreme Court on Friday. The case claims the medical isolation that began in Canadian prisons in March 2020 subjected prisoners to "inhumane rights restrictions" that amounted to solitary confinement.
title: Judge approves B.C. inmate's class action over 'inhumane' prison isolation during pandemic

description: Former astronaut and cabinet minister Marc Garneau has died. He was 76.
title: Marc Garneau, 1st Canadian astronaut in space, dead at age 76

description: Former astronaut and cabinet minister Marc Garneau has died. He was 76.
title: Marc Garneau, 1st Canadian astronaut in space, dead at age 76

description: Out of the first ministers' meeting in Saskatoon, expectations were high that Prime Minister Mark Carney would release a list of nation-building projects that his government would prioritize. He didn’t, but he offered some examples.
title: Here's a look at some major projects Canada's leaders hope to fast-track

description: Bryana Bongolan, a friend of Sean (Diddy) Combs's ex-girlfriend and accuser, R&B singer Cassie, says the hip-hop mogul held her over a 17th-floor apartment balcony and that she sometimes screamed in her sleep after the ordeal.
title: Sean (Diddy) Combs held Cassie's friend over 17th-floor balcony railing, trial hears

description: It has been a dreadful season for CF Montréal. Impact fans have been enduring home games rather than enjoying them, but for at least one night, 18,000 fans breathed life back into the building.
title: Canada beat Haiti in women's soccer, but Haitian-Montrealers still had plenty to celebrate

description: The number of newborns in Japan is decreasing faster than projected, with the number of annual births falling to a record low last year, according to government data released Wednesday.
title: Japan just recorded its fewest annual births since it started keeping records

description: When Virat Kohli, one of India's greatest cricketers, realized his 17-year dream of winning the Indian Premier League (IPL) title with his longtime team the ​​Royal Challengers Bengaluru, the moment brought tears to his eyes.
title: Indian cricket titan Virat Kohli wins elusive league title after retirement announcement

description: Windsor's claim of having Canada's best pizza has people in other parts of Ontario talking. It's even getting political, as the pizza rivalry heats up with Cornwall.
title: A slice from Windsor or Cornwall? Welcome to an Ontario border-city pizza battle

description: Interim NDP Leader Don Davies says his party will be voting against the government’s throne speech, meaning the Liberals will need to get support from another opposition party to survive the confidence vote.
title: NDP to vote against throne speech, forcing Liberals to find support elsewhere

description: A Canadian Forces corporal on Wednesday was found not guilty of forcible confinement and sexual assault following a judge-alone trial before the Ontario Court of Justice in Barrie, Ont.
title: Canadian Forces corporal acquitted of sexual assault, forcible confinement charges

description: Eleven people were killed and scores more injured after a stampede outside a cricket stadium in Bengaluru, in India's southern Karnataka state, where fervent fans had gathered to celebrate the first-ever Indian Premier League title win for the city's team.
title: Stampede after cricket victory kills at least 11 in India

description: Heather Hiscox will say good morning to loyal CBC News viewers for the last time this fall, as she steps away from the anchor desk after 20 years as host of CBC Morning Live on CBC News Network.
title: CBC's Heather Hiscox to sign off after 20 years hosting national morning news

description: Three men are facing a swath of charges — including multiple counts of attempted murder — linked to a brazen shooting at the Piper Arms Pub in Scarborough where a dozen people were hurt back in March.
title: 3 charged with attempted murder in wake of mass shooting at Toronto pub in March

description: Dutch opposition parties called Wednesday for fresh elections as soon as possible, a day after anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders sparked the collapse of the country's four-party coalition government.
title: The Dutch government has collapsed after far-right Wilders pulls out of coalition. What now?

description: The formerly non-affiliated New Brunswick Sen. David Richards has joined the Conservative Senate Caucus.
title: Giller Prize-winning author and senator David Richards joins Conservative caucus

description: A look at the U.S. real estate developer turned special envoy at the centre of some of the highest stakes geopolitical negotiations of our time.
title: Real estate, crypto, Middle East deals: Who is Steve Witkoff?

description: The world will never forget China's 1989 crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Tiananmen Square, Taiwan's president and the top U.S. diplomat said on the 36th anniversary of an event Beijing treats as taboo and allows no public remembrance.
title: We will never forget Tiananmen crackdown, Taiwan and U.S. say on 36th anniversary

description: An Australian woman accused of murdering three of her estranged husband's elderly relatives with poisonous mushrooms gave her account of the fatal lunch on Wednesday, in a case that has gripped the public.
title: Australian woman accused of murders with toxic mushrooms gives her account of fatal lunch

description: The U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF) will not give out any aid on Wednesday as it presses Israel to boost civilian safety beyond the perimeter of its distribution sites, a day after dozens of Palestinians seeking aid were killed.
title: U.S.-backed Gaza aid group halts distribution as 18 killed in Israeli strike on school shelter

description: Ariel Lukaniuk says a renovation at a neighbouring row house has allowed raccoons to get into her bedroom walls, but her complaints to the city have solved nothing. The city says it’s aware of the problem and the neighbour has taken steps to remove the raccoons.
title: 'It sounds like a horror movie': Toronto woman fed up with raccoon infestation amid neighbouring reno

description: Elijah Kodzo Motey's parents say they started noticing clues of his intelligence early on. He showed an aptitude for math and spelling by the age of two — and even led his daycare's storytime.
title: N.S. boy, 6, who just joined Mensa started multiplying as a toddler
Life is 'better after solar': Harnessing sunlight gives India's salt farmers freedom and profit
Canadian schools urged to buy local, but some supplies aren't available nearby
Carney says Canada having 'intensive discussions' with U.S. following latest tariff punch
Doubled tariffs raise concerns Canadian steel could be shut out of U.S., but some companies say they'll adjust
German, Norwegian officials urge Canada to join 'familiar family' in buying new submarines

description: Doug Ford’s government is blaming U.S. tariffs for the expansion of a controversial landfill project in southwestern Ontario — but experts say the conflict should serve as a wake-up call that time is running out to find long-term solutions to the province’s rapidly-filling landfills.
title: Canada-U.S. trade war could spark an 'immediate crisis' in Ontario's landfills

description: Herstmonceux Castle was abruptly shut down in 2023 following the discovery of serious structural issues. The problems seemed to come without warning, but a report obtained by CBC shows there hadn't been significant repairs to the castle's exterior or a detailed inspection of the estate since the 1990s.
title: Queen's University's U.K. castle was crumbling. A report cites 'ad hoc maintenance'

description: A high-ranking RCMP officer has decided to retire rather than appear before a disciplinary hearing over a case of sexual misconduct involving a part-time colleague and university student, according to information obtained by Radio-Canada.
title: 'There's no justice,' says complainant as RCMP officer retires before misconduct hearing

description: UNESCO Global Geoparks are distinct regions with internationally important geology that tells the story of earth’s history. UNESCO revalidates geoparks every four years, and three of the five in Canada — among only 229 on the planet — have been told they need to improve.
title: Two Canadian UNESCO Geoparks cautioned to make improvements or risk losing status
